candidate_profile.name: Sarah Chen
candidate_profile.background: BS Computer Science, 8 years experience at tech companies
candidate_profile.current_role: Senior Software Engineer at Series C Startup

evaluation.summary: Excellent technical match with 8 years Python/AWS experience building distributed systems. Strong portfolio demonstrates capability to own backend architecture. Currently at Series C, interested in earlier-stage opportunity with more ownership. Minor compensation concern due to current comp level but startup equity interest mitigates risk.
strengths: Designed and deployed microservices architecture handling 500k daily active users
Deep PostgreSQL expertise with documented query optimization reducing latency 60%
Led team of 4 engineers through SOC 2 compliance process
Strong AWS skills including Lambda, ECS, RDS, and CloudFormation
concerns: Current compensation likely $180k+; may be at high end of budget
Seeking earlier-stage startup which may indicate preference for equity over stability

interview_focus.why_important: Role requires building new services and owning backend architecture decisions
questions: Walk me through your decision process when designing the microservices architecture at your current company
What trade-offs did you consider between monolith and microservices?
How did you handle service communication and data consistency?

interview_focus.why_important: Role includes mentoring junior engineers and taking technical ownership
questions: Tell me about leading your team through SOC 2 compliance. What challenges did you face?
How do you balance hands-on coding with mentorship responsibilities?

notes: Traditional strong candidate. Would pass standard ATS systems easily.
